main event: Observer watched a round, yellowish colored object travel toward the south on February 26, 1967.
interesting points: The object was described as being about the size of a dime held at arm's length., The object moved very slowly before disappearing rapidly., The sighting was consistent with that of a satellite observation., Atmospheric conditions may have distorted the sighting., The observer's location was 25 miles out of McAllen, Texas.
